page.title: 18LIFE STYLES.PEOPLE OF AREA.
page.content: Interview of landlord of canal public house by W.I.Denton. The old bargees' inn is 242 years old. It is next to the former loading wharf once called Woolsthorpe Docks.The inn served the Grantham/Nottingham Canal narrow boat workers up to the early 20th century. The inn has been extensively enlarged and the front rooms have been changed round to face the lane.The dining room seats 36.Bar snacks and meals are prepared by two cooks.There is also a games room.In the inn there are tables made from apple and elm trees.The inn is popular with all ages.In December there is a motor cycle rally called the Ice Rally.500 druids came last year with 280 motorcycles.They camped on Green Lane.A County grant has enabled oak trees to be planted on the approach road and site of old bungalow.
